Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Peptide PGQ (natural AMPs; UCLL1a; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: skin, Stomach,African clawed frog,Xenopus laevis, Africa

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Weakly active against E. coli (ATCC 25922) (MIC 62-250 ug/ml) and K. pneumoniae (13883) (MIC 125-250 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa (27853) (MIC 250-500), S.aureus 29213 (MIC 250-500), S.faecalis (29212), and C.albicans 14053 (MIC 250-500 ug/ml).SAR: Amidated PGQ became more active against E. coli and K. pneumoniae (31-125 ug/ml).Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Moore KS, Bevins CL, Brasseur MM, Tomassini N, Turner K, Eck H, Zasloff M.1991
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides in the stomach of Xenopus laevis.
